entry.title: Unable to Register Program IM_HANA_ABAPADAPTER
entry.content:
Hello SAP Technology Experts, 

I am currently implementing the integration between SAP S/4HANA and SAP Datasphere (Replication Flows) scenario.

However, during one of the steps, I am facing an issue regarding creating an RFC connection in the S/4HANA On-Premise system.

Note: I do not have OS Access, hence tried to execute the below command first from the program (RSBDCOS0). 
rfcexec -a IM_HANA_ABAPADAPTER -g <Hostname> -x SAPGW<Instance no.> -s <SID> &
The initial path from where I executed the program was /usr/sap/SID/D<xx>/work.

It did not worked, then I coordinated with our partner team to add an entry with the Program name IM_HANA_ABAP_ADAPTER and the value of Host = *  Access = * Cancel = *
However still I am getting the error that Program IM_HANA_ABAPADAPTER not registered error while testing the RFC Connection

Note: We have the DP Agent connectivity working with Datasphere and Cloud Connector Configuration Steps is also done successfully. Once we sort this connection issue then we can go ahead with the S/4HANA Connection setup

Anyone faced the similar issue ?
Looking for your suggestions and solutions.

Thanks and Regards
Anurag

entry.title: Everything You Need to Know About the SAP Young Professionals Program
entry.content:
If you‚Äôre an ambitious graduate looking to launch your tech consulting career, the SAP Young Professionals program might be the opportunity you‚Äôve been waiting for! This free, immersive training experience opens doors to become an SAP Associate Consultant and kick-start your career among SAP's. 

What is the SAP Young Professionals program?

It is a free, 2-3 month intensive training initiative from the SAP Digital Skills Center that aims to equip recent university graduates (with less than 3 years of graduation) with SAP knowledge, soft skills, and certifications that prepare them for SAP consulting-related position within the EMEA region. 

Graduates are trained in SAP technologies such as: SAP S/4HANA, SAP Analytics Cloud, Artificial Intelligence, SAP Business Technology Platform, within others ((Modules may vary by cohort or region).

Who is eligible for the program?

Applicants typically need to meet the following criteria.

  • Hold a university degree (Bachelor‚Äôs or higher). 
  • Be a recent graduate (within the past 3 years).
  • Be currently unemployed or underemployed
  • Show strong English proficiency.
  • Be citizens or legal residents of the country where the program is being offered.

Note: Specific requirements may vary depending on country and region.

What does the program include?

Over the course of 2‚Äì3 months, participants will:

  • Earn globally recognized certifications 
  • Gain access to SAP Learning Hub and be trained by SAP specialists 
  • Develop soft skills
  • Have the possibility of starting your career as Associate Consultant in SAP's ecosystem (partners + customers)

Is the program really free?

Yes. The SAP Digital Skills Center delivers this program at no cost to participants as part of SAP‚Äôs mission to close the digital skills gap and support sustainable employment. SAP invests in rising talent to help drive digital transformation across industries.

Is employment guaranteed after completing the program?

While job placement is not guaranteed, one of the key goals of YPP is to connect graduates with SAP partners and customers who are actively hiring. Many graduates secure employment within the SAP ecosystem shortly after completing the program. However, success depends on the graduate's performance, certification results, and engagement throughout the course.

How to apply?

Applications are submitted via üëâ SAP Digital Skills Center portal.

Keep an eye on the website or SAP‚Äôs social media channels for announcements about new program cohorts in your region.

entry.title: Need a Function Module for mass activation/inactivation of Measuring Point in SAP
entry.content:
Measuring Point can be marked active/inactive individually using tcode IK02> Measuring Point> Functions> Activate/Inactivate.
But for doing it for multiple measuring points at once in bulk- a function module is needed.
Need help in that regard.

entry.title: Growth Rebate in Condition Contract
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We wants to reward our customers that grow their purchase value by more than 15% YoY. Rebates are only applicable if current-year sales exceed base year by a defined percentage.

 For e.g -   Base year: 2024 - Target year: 2025 - Incentive: 5% rebate on incremental sales exceeding 15% growth

Does this scenario us possible in standard CCM S/4 HANA 2023 ? if yes How? 

Thank You

aw01n shows a problem

entry.title: Condition contract management delta accrual Foreign currency impact
entry.content:
We use CCM purchasing side. We book accruals with every goods receipt - if a purchase order is in FX we book the accrual in FX and local currency, converted at M rate.
When we have to adjust the % of the condition contract, we run a delta accrual at month end. Also this is posted with M rate.

During the final settlement of the contract, which typically happens in a different month and at a different M rate, the settlement against the vendor is made in the vendor purchasing currency at the correct amount (document currency of the settlement document not equal local currency). However the accrual which is build up to this point is not correctly reversed: if we only have accruals from goods receipts, these are converted from local currency back to document currency of the settlement document at the M rate --> the accrual in local currency is correctly reversed, there is a remaining balance in document currency as expected.

However as soon as we have delta accrual postings in the mix, these are not converted back from local currency to document currency but in the settlement document these delta accruals only show up in settlement document currency and are converted at settlement M rate to local currency. In the end the local currency accrual is not fully reversed. 

Example:
We post 100 Euro goods receipt, 120 USD local currency accrual, M Rate 1 -->1.2

Delta Accrual in the same month goes 50 Euro --> 60 USD. At this point our accrual is 180 USD

Then we settle a different month at M rate 1-->1.3
The 120 USD are backed out at 92.31 EUR

The delta accrual however is converted from 50 Euro to 65 USD and backed out at 65. USD. Hence we back out 185 USD accrual which is wrong.
In the calculation view of the settlement document i can see that the delta accrual line is completely shown in Eur, whereas the other accrual lines are shown in settlement and local currency. 
does anyone have an idea on how to manage a complete reversal of the accrual during final settlement in a  scenario involving FX?

entry.title: Incorrect scale level picked during final settlement for quantity-based rebate condition
entry.content:
Hello,

In a condition contract using condition type RES1 with Base Scale & condition table 163, we‚Äôve maintained quantity-based scales for two materials: 

Material A: 1 PC = 1%, 5 PC = 2%, 10 PC = 3%

Material B: 20 PC = 2%, 30 PC = 4%, 40 PC = 6%

An invoice contains 7 PC of Material A & 32 PC of Material B. However, during  final settlement, the system incorrectly applies 3% for Material A & 6% for Material B. instead of the expected 2% & 4% resp.

This issue does not occur when only one condition record exists in the contract. Why is the system picking incorrect scale values when multiple condition records are maintained?

Thank you

entry.title: Issue related to stock becoming negative during goods movements
entry.content:
Hello Team, 

 

As part of S4 Conversation, we have installed new system as SS4.

 

All our developments are going in SS4 system. During our testing, most of the stock movements are ending up with below error.

 

While analyzing the error, we got to know SAP Note 168888 for this issue is related to inconsistency in stock tables. It can be fixed only by SAP Developer. 

However, when trying to raise a OSS message, the portal is not allowing to complete the submission.

What is the right way to report this to SAP support.

 

Regards,

entry.title: Deviating number of table entries after ugprade to S4
entry.content:
Dear SAP-Uers,

we have done a comparisson of the no. of table entries before and after a migration to the RISE platform including an upgrade from ECC to S4/HANA.

We have found quite a few tables were the number of entries is deviating from the number on the source system, which include also some customizing tables.

We understand that during the upgrade also new customizing entries are delivered and on the other hand outdated entries are deleted, but is there some documentation what is changed during the upgrade? We would like to include this for audit reasons.

Regards

Kevin Wedding

entry.title: Document Compression in DMS.
entry.content:
We are currently using the Document Management Service, Integration Option in our production system on SAP BTP. We have observed that all documents being attached via our application are getting stored in their original size within the DMS.

We would like to understand why the documents are not being compressed before being stored in DMS. Additionally, we are looking for guidance on the following:

  1. Is document compression supported during upload/attachment in the DMS (Integration Option)?

  2. If yes, what configurations or custom implementations are required to enable compression of attachments before they are stored?

  3. Are there any recommended best practices or tools to handle this compression efficiently within the BTP ecosystem

entry.title: Error in ABAP Cloud - "The Use of table /SCWM/T340D is not permitted"
entry.content:
I am building a code "ready for cloud" in on premise system and code below is triggering error message "The Use of table /SCWM/T340D is not permitted" -->

METHODS unpack_outer_hu

IMPORTING

is_t340D TYPE /scwm/t340d

is_ltap TYPE /scwm/ltap

EXPORTING

ev_del_level TYPE i.

 Normally it happens when object or table is not released to ABAP Cloud, we are having this error message for several EWM objects, is there any way to release it to ABAP Cloud?

I also tried to find some CDS view to use it, but didn¬¥t find any CDS view related with table /scwm/t340d.

ABAP Cloud EWM - Basis

entry.title: S/4HANA EHS Risk Assessment - Delivery of List REACH-SVHC
entry.content:
Dear experts, 

in S/4HANA EHS for Workplace Safety (component EHS-SUS-HS, not SAP EHS for Safety data sheet and dangerous goods) the regulatory lists REACH-SVHC, ROHS and REACH-ANNEX 14 were delivered via SAP Notes. 

(Note 2427915, Note 2116459) 

In newer releases S/4 On Premise 2023 the above mentioned notes cannot be implemented. 

Are the regulatory lists REACH-SVHC, ROHS and REACH-ANNEX 14 still delivered and updated by SAP?

Thank you

Duc

entry.title: Influencing posting price at GR with BAPI_GOODSMVT_CREATE
entry.content:
Hi there.

We are trying to influence the material price when posting a goods receipt with BAPI_GOODSMVT_CREATE.
Therefore we are using the field AMOUNT_LC of structure GOODSMVT_ITEM. 

According to it"s documentation (BAPI_EXBWR) this field can be used for

"The value of the movement is calculated automatically by the system. However, it is possible to enter an amount manually if the item is to be valuated at a different price."

But is seems this documentation is not accurate, since when we are setting a different price in structure GOODSMVT_ITEM-AMOUNT_LC only MSEG-EXBWR gets updated with this, but not MSEG-DMBTR which is the base for the valuation of the material document. 
Is it really possible to influence the price with field AMOUNT_LC in BAPI_GOODSMVT_CREATE?
Maybe someone made the same experience and has a solution for it
Somehow the documentation of  BAPI_EXBWR seems to be misleading.

Thank you very much in advance
Best regards

Heinz

entry.title: Is it possible to separate the calculation of interest rates by customizing?
entry.content:
Question

Is it possible to separate the calculation of interest rates by customizing?

The invoice and accounting require the amounts of each interest rate to be displayed separately.

 

Analysis 

 At the customer XXXXX, it is required that the FINT transaction calculates and settles the interest and the surcharge separately. At this moment, in the test, the settlement of interest and the surcharge is totaled for the calculation, and thus it is carried to the generated accounting document.  

The client requires that the amount of interest (in this case 18%) be shown separately from the surcharge (in this case 2%) in the accounting records.
